content.description: If you hiked out here, you might as well climb this. It can be lead with a slight but safe runout or toproped from the main fixed rap anchor.
content.protection: A TR or Stoppers and doubles to #1 then singles of larger cams for the upper section.
content.location:
It starts left of

Breakdown

and finishes same as for

Breakdown

.

content.description: Climb the broken chimney with various moves. There is one cruxy sequence to pass the lower roof.
content.location: It ascends the obvious, broken chimney on the left side of the cliff.

content.description:
Climb the cleanest OW/squeeze chimney on this cliff! It is just right of

Breakdown

.
content.protection: Doubles to triples of cams to a #6 and a full set of Stoppers.
content.location:
It is near the "prow" of this cliff. You can't miss it. It ascends a clean, long offwidth that goes almost all the way to the top!

Hike climber's left, and exit at the fixed anchor, or hike off.

content.description: This is the leftmost route on the cliff. There is a chimney just to the right of the line. Climb both thin and wide sections to a shelf 40 feet up, then finish right up the wide chimney or do another 15 foot headwall and belay on 2 #4s at the top.
content.protection: A doubles rack to a #4 and Stoppers.
content.location:
It is on the left side of Instant Karma Cliff.

Rap climber's right of the gully/chimney off a fixed anchor (bring extra webbing to be safe).

content.description: Climb hands and fists up to a left-trending roof, follow it to the top, and set a gear belay or hike off.
content.protection: Doubles or triples to a #3.5 and Stoppers.
content.location: This is the first documented route right of the prow.

content.description: Climb a corner crack to the top, and get a gear anchor. This is more strenuous than it looks.

Follow the most obvious line to the right of

Karma Corner

.

Make a gear anchor, hike off, or rap from a central fixed anchor.
content.location: The Right Most line on the Instant Karma Cliff

content.description:
This is a great route that climbs fists and finishes on the line just right of

Plow Position

. Set a gear anchor.
content.protection: Doubles or triples to a #3.5 and Stoppers.
content.location:
It ascends the fist crack just left of the arete and just right of

Plow Position

.

content.description:
Breakdown is an excellent old school sandbag. Start with moderate offwidth, which turns into strenuous, flaring hand crack (crux) that ends at a bush. Traverse left, and continue up on good hand jams until meeting the second bush. From here, continue on a nice finger crack at a lower angle to the top.

There is a rappel anchor to the left with a questionable bolt backed up by a ton of cordelettes wrapped around a block.
content.protection: A full rack, and a #5 and a #6 are useful.
